enWisdom: Vain desire is the enemy of reason
Vain desire is the bane of the intellects
Vain desire is the bane of the intellects
Vain desire is the partner of blindness
Vain desire is a hidden ailment
Vain desire is the opposite of reason
The bane of the intellect is vain desire
The cause of corruption of the intellect is vain desire
Yielding to vain desire corrupts the intellect
Being overcome by vain desire corrupts [one’s] faith and reason
Combat your vain desire with your intellect and you will acquire right guidance

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ عَقْلٍ أَسِيرٍ عِنْدَ هَوًى أَمِيرٍ
enWisdom: Many a mind has been made subservient by a commanding desire
Nothing opposes reason like vain desire
Opposing vain desire is a cure for the intellect
With vain desire there is no [reason and] intellect
Intellect and vain desire do not go together
The smallest vain desire can corrupt the intellect

Wisdom: صِلْ عَجَلَتَكَ بِتَأَنِّيكَ وَسَطْوَتَكَ بِرِفْقِكَ وَشَرَّكَ بِخَيْرِكَ وَانْصُرِ الْعَقْلَ عَلَى الْهَوَى تَمْلِكِ النُّهَى
enWisdom: Bind your haste with your deliberateness, your domination with your friendliness and your evil [traits] with your good [ones]Help the intellect overcome vain desires and you will possess understanding

Wisdom: قَدْ أَحْيَا عَقْلَهُ وَأَمَاتَ شَهْوَتَهُ وَأَطَاعَ رَبَّهُ وَعَصَى نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: He [the believer] has enlivened his intellect, killed his lust, obeyed his Lord and disobeyed his lower-self

Wisdom: لَمْ يَعْقِلْ مَنْ وَلِهَ بِاللَّعِبِ وَاسْتَهْتَرَ بِاللَّهْوِ وَالطَّرَبِ
enWisdom: He who is distracted by idle sport and seeks pleasure in amusement and song, has no intelligence

Wisdom: مِنْ حَقِّ الْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يَقْهَرَ هَوَاهُ قَبْلَ ضِدِّهِ
enWisdom: It is from the rights of the intelligent person to vanquish his vain desire before his adversary

Wisdom: أَقْرَبُ الْآرَاءِ مِنَ النُّهَى أَبْعَدُهَا مِنَ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The closest of opinions to reason will be the furthest of them from vain desire

Wisdom: خَيْرُ الْآرَاءِ أَبْعَدُهَا مِنَ الْهَوَى وَأَقْرَبُهَا مِنَ السَّدَادِ
enWisdom: The best of opinions is the furthest of them from vain desire and the closest of them to pertinence
Combat your vain desire with your knowledge and your anger with your forbearance

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَسْتَطِيعُ الْهُدَى مَنْ يَغْلِبُهُ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: How is the one who is overcome by [his] vain desire able to get true guidance?!

Wisdom: لَوْ ارْتَفَعَ الْهَوَى لَأَنِفَ غَيْرُ الْمُخْلِصِ مِنْ عَمَلِهِ
enWisdom: If vain desire were to be lifted, the insincere person would despise [and feel ashamed of] his [own] action
One who is controlled by his vain desire goes astray
Whoever opposes his vain desire has followed [the path of] knowledge

Wisdom: مَنِ اتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ أَعْمَاهُ وَأَصَمَّهُ وَأَذَلَّهُ وَأَضَلَّهُ
enWisdom: Whoever follows his vain desire, it blinds him, deafens him, humiliates him and misguides him

Wisdom: مَنْ نَظَرَ بِعَيْنِ هَوَاهُ افْتُتِنَ وَجَارَ وَعَنْ نَهْجِ السَّبِيلِ زَاغَ وَحَارَ
enWisdom: Whoever looks with the eye of his vain desire falls into temptation and wrongdoing, and deviates and turns away from the clear open path
Never let your vain desire relegate your knowledge
